description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to vary the wording of condition 16 of planning permission P082527 dated 16 March 2009 for the 'Demolition of existing buildings on site (including a locally listed building at 29-30 Wakley Street) and mixed use redevelopment of the site in the form of two seven storey blocks, one comprising 8 flats (4x2 bed, 2x1 bed, and 2 studios) and the other 136 self contained student bedrooms (sui generis) with 300sqm of A1(shops) / A2(financial & professional services) / A3(food & drink) / B1(business) uses at ground floor levels to both buildings.'
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than 21/11/2011.  

REASON: To ensure the commencement timescale for the development is not extended beyond that of the original planning permission [LBI ref: P081736].  Furthermore, to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5)
